SEARCH

Class DES

java.lang.Object
DES
public class DES extends Object
This class is used to crypt and decrypt a message using the DES algorithm

  • Constructor Details

    • DES

      public DES()
      Constructor of the class DES. It generates a random master key of 64 bits (containing only 0 or 1). It also creates an array (tab_cles) of 16 sub-keys of 48 bits each.

  • Method Details

    • stringToBits

      public int[] stringToBits(String message)
      Translate a String in a String containing only 0 and 1 (it is the binary representation of the initial String). The translation is stored character by character in an array after being converted to int.
      Parameters:
      message - the string to be converted.
      Returns:
      an array of int containing only 0 and 1 (it is the binary representation of the initial String).
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if message is an empty string.
      NullPointerException - if message is null.

    • bitsToString

      public String bitsToString(int[] blocs)
      Translate an array of int containing only 0 and 1 to a String. It concatenates all the elements of the array and converts the resulting binary String to a human-readable String. In fact, it is the reverse of the previous method (stringToBits).
      Parameters:
      blocs - the array of int to be converted into String.
      Returns:
      a String translation of the array blocs (binary) in human-readable format.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if blocs is an array of length 0.
      NullPointerException - if blocs is null.

    • generePermutation

      public int[] generePermutation(int taille)
      Create an array of length taille and fill it with the numbers from 0 to taille - 1 included (array[i] = i). Then, it randomly permutes the elements of the array and returns it.
      Parameters:
      taille - the size of the permuted array.
      Returns:
      an array of int (length = taille), each int is unique (from 0 to taille - 1 both included) and is located at a random index.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if taille is negative.

    • permutation

      public int[] permutation(int[] tab_permutation, int[] bloc)
      Shuffle bloc according to tab_permutation (The element at the index i of bloc will be moved to the index tab_permutation[i] of the returning array).
      Parameters:
      tab_permutation - the array created by the method generePermutation.
      bloc - the array of int to be permuted.
      Returns:
      an array of int resulting from the permutation of the elements of the array bloc according to tab_permutation.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if tab_permutation or bloc is null.

    • invPermutation

      public int[] invPermutation(int[] tab_permutation, int[] bloc)
      The reverse of the previous method (permutation). It cancels the permutation of the array bloc according to tab_permutation. The two arrays must be of equal size.
      Parameters:
      tab_permutation - the array created by the method generePermutation.
      bloc - the array of int to be reverse-permuted.
      Returns:
      an array where the permutation has been reversed.
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if tab_permutation[i] >= bloc.length || tab_permutation[i] invalid input: '<' 0.
      NullPointerException - if tab_permutation or bloc is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if tab_permutation.length != bloc.length.

    • decoupage

      public int[][] decoupage(int[] bloc, int tailleBlocs)
      Cut an array bloc in nbBlocs of "equal size" and store sub-blocs in a 2D array. This method will only be used if nbBlocs is a multiple of bloc.length. Moreover, the tailleBloc must be a multiple of bloc.length.
      Parameters:
      bloc - the array of int to be cut.
      tailleBlocs - the length of the sub-blocs.
      Returns:
      a 2D array of int containing nbBlocs sub-blocs of equal size (tailleBlocs) such that the index i of the 2D array represents the sub-bloc i.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if tailleBlocs invalid input: '<'= 0.

    • recollage_bloc

      public int[] recollage_bloc(int[][] blocs)
      The reverse of the previous method (decoupage). It concatenates all the arrays into one.
      Parameters:
      blocs - the 2D array of int to be concatenated.
      Returns:
      a 1D array which is the concatenation of all the arrays contained in blocs.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if blocs is null.

    • genereCle

      public void genereCle(int n)
      Generate the key at the index n of tab_cles. The master key is permuted according to PC1 and then split into two halves. Each half is rotated to the left by a certain number of bits (TAB_DECALAGE[n]) depending on the round. The two halves are then concatenated and permuted according to PC2. The result is stored in tab_cles at the index n.
      Parameters:
      n - the index of the key to be generated.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if n invalid input: '<' 0 || n > 15.

    • decalle_gauche

      public int[] decalle_gauche(int[] bloc, int nbCran)
      Shift/rotate bloc by nbCran to the left.
      Parameters:
      bloc - the array of int to be shifted
      nbCran - the number of shift to the left
      Returns:
      a 1D array which is the result of the array bloc shifted/rotated nbCran to the left.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if bloc is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if bloc.length invalid input: '<' 1.

    • intToBinaryArray

      public int[] intToBinaryArray(int n, int size)
      Converts a positive int n into its binary representation and store each bit in the returning 1D array. The first element of the array is the most significant bit and the last one is the least significant bit ([1, 0, 1, 0] = 10 for example). We will only use this method with size = 4, but it can be used with any size.
      Parameters:
      n - the int to be converted (must be positive or equal to 0).
      size - the size of the returning array
      Returns:
      a 1D array of length size containing the binary representation of n.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if size invalid input: '<' 0 or if n invalid input: '<' 0.

    • fonction_S

      public int[] fonction_S(int[] tab, int noRonde)
      Calculate the value of the array S corresponding to the 6 bits of tab. The first and last bits of tab are used to determine the line of the array S and the 4 bits in the middle are used to determine the column of the S-Box. The result is an int which is then converted in binary and stored in a 1D array of length 4.
      Parameters:
      tab - the array of int to be converted.
      noRonde - the index of the round.
      Returns:
      a 1D array of length 4 containing the binary representation of the int corresponding to a certain line (first and last bit) and column (every other) of the array S at the round noRonde.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if tab is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if tab.length != 6 or noRonde invalid input: '<' 0 || noRonde > 15.

    • fonction_F

      public int[] fonction_F(int[] uneCle, int[] unD, int noRonde)
      Apply the function F to unD. The array unD is first permuted according to E. Then, XOR is applied between uneCle and unD. The result is split into 8 sub-blocs of length 6. Each sub-bloc is then used as a parameter for the fonction_S. The result of each fonction_S is stored in a 2D-array which will be concatenated into a 1D-array. This array is permuted according to P and the result is returned.
      Parameters:
      uneCle - a key contained in tab_cles (an array of int of length 48), it contains only 0 or 1.
      unD - the array of int to be used in the function F (length of the array = 32), it contains only 0 or 1.
      noRonde - the index of the round.
      Returns:
      an array of length 32 (result of the function F to unD).
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if uneCle or unD is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if unD.length != 32.

    • xor

      public int[] xor(int[] tab1, int[] tab2)
      Apply the bitwise operator XOR between the two arrays, indexes by indexes. It returns a new array containing the result of the XOR.
      Parameters:
      tab1 - the first array to be XORed with the second one.
      tab2 - the second array to be XORed with the first one.
      Returns:
      a new array containing the result of the XOR between tab1 and tab2.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if tab1 or tab2 is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if tab1.length != tab2.length.

    • crypte

      public int[] crypte(String message_clair)
      Crypt a String message_clair with the DES algorithm.
      Parameters:
      message_clair - the string to be crypted.
      Returns:
      an array of int containing the crypted message.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if message_clair is null.

    • decrypte

      public String decrypte(int[] messageCodé)
      Decrypt a message codé with the DES algorithm.
      Parameters:
      messageCodé - the array of int to be decrypted.
      Returns:
      a String containing the decrypted message.
